channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Amazon shares slide on revenue miss, disappointing guidance for third quarter
item.description: Amazon missed on revenue for the second quarter and gave a forecast for the current quarter that fell short of Wall Street's expectations.

item.title: Europe markets close 1.3% lower after U.S. data, Bank of England cut; banks tumble 4.5%
item.description: European markets closed lower on Thursday as investors processed a raft of central bank action and fresh U.S. economic data.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: Can India's hot deal-making season extend to a free trade agreement?
item.description: India and the U.K. are motivated and see each other benefiting from a deal — but a number of key demands from both stand in the way of a quick agreement.

item.title: Putin's Trader: How Russian hackers stole millions from U.S. investors
item.description: This CNBC documentary is about the rise and fall of Vladislav Klyushin and his business empire. Klyushin was just released from a U.S. prison in a prisoner swap.

item.title: WSJ reporter Evan Gershkovich, ex-Marine Whelan released in U.S., Russia prisoner swap
item.description: The swap of American, Russian and German prisoners is the largest such exchange since the Cold War.

item.title: 10-year Treasury yield falls below 4% for the first time since February
item.description: Treasury yields were steady as investors digested comments from Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, who suggested a September rate cut was on the table.

item.title: Apple sales rise 5%, topping estimates as iPad and Services revenues jump
item.description: Apple reported earnings after the bell on Thursday.

item.title: I’ve been to 100 countries. I didn't expect to want to return to these 5
item.description: Travel enthusiast Todd Miller identifies the five countries that he had assumed would be "one and done" places, but that left him wanting to know much more.

item.title: Here's how much athletes at the Paris Olympics earn for winning medals
item.description: Aside from a medal, a stuffed toy of the Olympics mascot and an official event poster, some medal winners are accorded additional financial rewards.

item.title: Israeli military says it killed Hamas armed wing leader Mohammed Deif in Gaza airstrike last month
item.description: Israel's military on Thursday said it killed the chief of Hamas' military wing, Mohammed Deif, in an airstrike in July.

item.title: Wayfair CEO likens home goods slowdown to 2008 financial crisis
item.description: Online home goods company Wayfair has seen sluggish demand against high interest rates, but reprieve could come if the federal reserve cuts rates in September.

item.title: Moderna stock falls 20% as it slashes guidance on low EU sales, tough U.S. vaccine market
item.description: Moderna now expects 2024 product revenue to come in between $3 billion and $3.5 billion, down from a previous guidance of $4 billion.

item.title: Rolls-Royce shares soar to all-time high on reinstated dividend, raised profit guidance
item.description: Shares of Rolls-Royce jumped to an all-time high after the company reinstated its dividend and raised its profit forecast.

item.title: Barclays profit dips in the second quarter, beats estimates
item.description: The British lender is undergoing a major restructuring program in a bid to boost profits.

item.title: Shell beats second-quarter profit expectations, launches $3.5 billion share buyback program
item.description: Shell on Thursday posted stronger-than-expected second-quarter profit after issuing a warning over lower fossil fuel prices and refining margins.

item.title: World’s first major AI law enters into force — here's what it means for U.S. tech giants
item.description: The European Union's landmark artificial intelligence law officially enters into force Thursday — and it means tough changes for American technology giants.

item.title: Meta's advertising growth is proof that hefty AI spending is already paying off
item.description: For investors skeptical of Meta's massive investment in artificial intelligence infrastructure, CEO Mark Zuckerberg is urging them to look at the results.

item.title: 'Internal battle' in Modi's BJP on whether India needs Chinese investments, Natixis chief Asia economist says
item.description: India has ambitious plans to become a manufacturing powerhouse in Asia, but it might not be able to do so without Chinese investments, experts said.

item.title: Japan confirms $36.8 billion currency intervention as weak yen pushes BOJ to hike interest rates
item.description: Japanese authorities spent 5.53 trillion yen, or $36.8 billion, to shore up the yen in July, official data published Wednesday showed.

item.title: Asia markets mixed after Powell signals rate cut; Japan stocks tumble as yen strengthens
item.description: At his press conference, Fed Chair Jerome Powell said a rate cut in September is “on the table,” provided the inflation data continues to be encouraging.

item.title: More people are exploring alcohol-free trips and 'sober curious' vacations
item.description: A growing number of people are exploring "dry tripping," "sober travel" and "alcohol-free vacations" for reasons related to physical and mental health.

item.title: Microsoft says OpenAI is now a competitor in AI and search
item.description: What once was a strategic, long-term partnership between the world's biggest software company and an AI startup has morphed into something more complicated.

item.title: Nvidia shares soar 13% after Microsoft quells fears that AI buildout is too fast
item.description: Microsoft plans to spend even more on Nvidia-based infrastructure next year than it did in 2024.

item.title: Arm issues light earnings guidance as the company stops disclosing number of chips reported as shipped
item.description: After facing declines in chip shipment counts, now Arm is focusing on higher-value markets, including accelerators for artificial intelligence.

item.title: TikTok-owner ByteDance's Singapore workers suffer mass food poisoning
item.description: An office of TikTok-owner ByteDance in Singapore was hit by a mass food poisoning incident on Tuesday, according to local authorities.

item.title: Uber to start using BYD cars in Europe, Latin America and develop 'autonomous-capable vehicles'
item.description: Uber plans to use 100,000 electric BYD cars on its ride-hailing platform, starting in Europe and Latin America, the two companies announced Wednesday.

item.title: Middle East on knife-edge after killing of Hamas leader in Iran; Israel's opponents vow retaliation
item.description: Iran has pledged to retaliate, but how it does so could determine how intensely the conflict escalates.

item.title: 9/11 mastermind Khalid Sheikh Mohammad, 2 others charged in terror plot reach plea deals
item.description: Khalid Sheikh Mohammad is accused of masterminding the Sept. 11 terror attacks in which the Twin Towers were destroyed and almost 3,000 people died.

item.title: Meta’s Reality Labs posts $4.5 billion loss in second quarter
item.description: Meta's virtual reality and augmented reality focused Reality Labs unit recorded an operating loss of $4.48 billion in the second quarter.

item.title: Meta shares pop on revenue and earnings beat, better-than-expected forecast
item.description: Meta reported second-quarter earnings on Wednesday after the bell. Here are the results:
